title_en: Taint-Based Code Slicing for LLMs-based Malicious NPM Package Detection
title_zh: 基于污点分析的代码切片技术用于LLM驱动的恶意NPM包检测
summary_en: The increasing sophistication of malware attacks in the npm ecosystem, characterized by obfuscation and complex logic, necessitates advanced detection methods. Recently, researchers have turned their attention from traditional detection approaches to Large Language Models (LLMs) due to their strong capabilities in semantic code understanding. However, while LLMs offer superior semantic reasoning for code analysis, their practical application is constrained by limited context windows and high computational cost. This paper addresses this challenge by introducing a novel framework that leverages code slicing techniques for an LLM-based malicious package detection task. We propose a specialized taintbased slicing technique for npm packages, augmented by a heuristic backtracking mechanism to accurately capture malicious data flows across asynchronous, event-driven patterns (e.g., callbacks and Promises) that elude traditional analysis. An evaluation on a dataset of more than 5000 malicious and benign npm packages demonstrates that our approach isolates security-relevant code, reducing input volume by over 99% while preserving critical behavioral semantics. Using the DeepSeek-Coder-6.7B model as the classification engine, our approach achieves a detection accuracy of 87.04%, substantially outperforming a naive token-splitting baseline (75.41%) and a traditional static-analysis-based approach. These results indicate that semantically optimized input representation via code slicing not only mitigates the LLM context-window bottleneck but also significantly enhances reasoning precision for security tasks, providing an efficient and effective defense against evolving malicious open-source packages.
summary_zh: NPM生态系统中恶意软件攻击日益复杂化，其特点包括代码混淆与复杂逻辑，这要求我们采用更先进的检测方法。近年来，由于大语言模型在代码语义理解方面的强大能力，研究者的关注点已从传统检测方法转向大语言模型。然而，尽管大语言模型在代码分析中具备卓越的语义推理能力，但其实际应用受限于有限的上下文窗口和高昂的计算成本。本文针对这一挑战，提出了一种新颖的框架，该框架利用代码切片技术来支持基于大语言模型的恶意软件包检测任务。我们专门为NPM包设计了一种基于污点分析的切片技术，并通过启发式回溯机制进行增强，以精准捕获传统分析难以处理的、跨异步事件驱动模式（如回调和Promise）的恶意数据流。在对超过5000个恶意与良性NPM包组成的数据集进行评估后表明，我们的方法能有效分离出与安全相关的代码，在保留关键行为语义的同时，将输入量减少了99%以上。使用DeepSeek-Coder-6.7B模型作为分类引擎，我们的方法实现了87.04%的检测准确率，显著优于简单的令牌分割基线方法（75.41%）和传统的基于静态分析的方法。这些结果表明，通过代码切片实现的语义优化输入表示，不仅缓解了大语言模型上下文窗口的瓶颈限制，而且显著提升了安全任务中的推理精度，为应对不断演变的恶意开源软件包提供了一种高效且有效的防御方案。
